title: Why doesn't this game have a Retro game mode?
body:
every game has one except WOW that deleted the vanilla server, and... and?

League

i mean what harm could it bring to the game? dota2 has a retro game mode and nothing happens to the main game, i think we all know why league doesn't have one

because everyone wouldn't play the game anymore, we're all exhausted of season 7, we're all exhausted of getting gangbanged bot lane by 4 or 5 people or the jungle being ruined by vi/lee/heca
we're all exhausted of seeing mages bot lane, if you're not i do because nothing is more frustrating than a "support" vel'koz/annie/brand/zyra/malz bringing more damage than an adc with little AP while bringing almost as much utility as normal supports
Mid lane is a shitfest of mages, overshadowing every assassins
Top lane is a shitfest of overpowered picks, old bruisers like renekton/wukong/jax just disappeared from the game and it won't be fixed because riot wakes up and changes 3 champions on pbe and then call it a day and wait 3 weeks to change 3 champions again

Champs get destroyed with their rework
{{champion:107}} {{champion:90}}  begging riot to revert their shit because the champion is no longer enjoyable, but hey i don't main rengar and malz i wonder what will happen to my main {{champion:29}} 

Please just let me play your old game riot, you were amazing back then let me get season 3 or season 5, the old good league of legends that didn't finish at 15 min that allowed us to show our mid game/late game skill and decision making, the good old game that had so much versatility and diversity where Lee sin was as viable as other picks until you buffed him 2 or 3 times.

replies.body: No you don't. You think you do, but you don't

What exactly do you want back?

Let me remind you of a few things:
Fiora, Poppy, Veigar.
5 Bloodthirsters.
S3 God-Kassadin.
Atmogs.
Thresh/Leona being the only viable supports.
S5 AP warwick.

People complained just as much back then, often for more valid reasons. People tend to forget the bad and remember the good.
We have Camille instead of Kassadin now.
Camille cant oneshot you from another lane (yet), like pre-nerf riftwalk (the range and damage got reduced a ton).

then give us a retro game mode? 2 things would happen:
-reality kick in, and riot wins their game is better now than before and retro game mode would just be a feature game mode
-Reality doesn't kick in, everyone plays the mode and riot realises how they fucked up the game and everyone would win because we would have fun again

I want this game mode just to see how creative people can get with how champions would go with every item that was ever made come back.

Reintroduce every item created. Put everything back to their original state. Go as far as to go back to the shitty graphics since release. Maybe have certain editions of champions based on their rework with choices of their considered their best patch.

It would totally be fun as hell seeing the old gimmicks that were gutted because Riot doesn't embrace new ideas very well. Some of them were gutted for very good reasons but how about no bounds in what comes back. It won't be like URF mode where people become try hards and spam the OP champions.

Unfortunately that game mode will never happen as it would likely be a massive shitstorm of bugs.

Same can be said for the older seasons

Lee Sin was broken asf with his E as slow, higher q base dmg, bigger and better shield.
Supports being no more than walking wards
Level snowballing was a thing in S3 and S2, gl doing anything vs a riven 1 level up on you.
People buying gold generation items with good cost effectiveness ,just waiting to make bank.
dfg 1shotting everyone, 
leona graves botlane dominating every matchup

etc etc

lee was average in season 5, he didn't have any attack speed slow and riot decided to buff him multiple time
they gave his ulti %bonus hp damage, improved his passive and buffed his lifesteal/spell vamp as well as his shield at rank 5 (280 instead of 200)

in my experience at least the game was SOOOOOOO balanced in high elo in pre-season 3 after black cleaver hot-fixe

If you don't believe me look at 2 things:
-LCS that had like 90% of its champs picked (even galio)
-patch notes that show everyone getting nerfed
for instance every ADC were picked, and every single one of them no exceptions got nerfed one by one, draven then varus then miss fortune ect.. the only ADC that wasn't picked was sivir

but nothing will beat the balance of season 2, every classes were all viable at the same time

Except season 2 had the most broken champs aside from win nhao(I wasn't around on win nhao release, so I cant tell for sure) aka: lebalanced and kassawin

And don't forget the 20% damage reduction ap burst mage gragas with 1.1 ult ratio.

The main reason earlier seasons had so much diversity is because there was no optimal way of playing the game, nobody knew what they were doing, they were just good at doing it.

I mean, I look back at those seasons and they were a lot of fun, we were all bad and everything was viable, but with today's standards it probably wouldn't be close to what it was.

"nobody knew what they were doing" 

fine let us know what we're doing and see by ourself if it was imbalanced or not

sure perfect balance didn't exist WE ALL KNOW THIS, but i'm sure it was better

come and bet with me if older seasons were worse no one would play the game mode bet and see if riot fucked up or not 

hint: they fucked up and everyone would stop playing the game if there was an other retro game mode, how do i know? because else they would have released it already

I haven't played DOTA to know how their feature worked, but what exactly are you looking for with this? For Riot to stand up severs for every version of the game back to alpha, and have client downloads for all of those patches? Or would they pick and choose patches from over the years to support? What's the policy for if someone finds a game-breaking bug with that patch (such as the instant recall bug, which was in the code long before it was discovered), do you patch Alpha League or do you leave it as is?

I think I'd rather have Riot work on fixing their spaghetti code so we have less instances where a champion that wasn't directly changed that patch has to be disabled because of a bug.
